CurrentSituation: Invoices and item details are checked manually, including expiration dates. Limited digital tools.
Phase1:
- Introduce barcode/QR scanning
- Centralize record-keeping in one spreadsheet/db
- Train Finance Director for automated PO approvals
- Upskill one in-house programmer with Python
Phase2: - Integrate real-time cross-referencing tool for deliveries vs. POs\n- Create dashboards/alerts for mismatches
Phase3: - Implement predictive algorithms to flag high-risk deliveries\n- Use ML for forecasting shortages or delays

CurrentSituation: Items inspected visually for damages and shelf-life. Near half-life items are rejected without data-based tracking.
Phase1:
- Record QC checks digitally (tablets/mobile)
- Basic color-coded alerts for near-expiry
- Finance Director learns basic automated checks
- In-house Python scripts for QC reporting
Phase2: - Employ sensors/image recognition for automatic damage detection\n- Link QC data to inventory records for auto-removal
Phase3: - AI-driven QC with predictive maintenance\n- Integrate computer vision for advanced anomaly detection

CurrentSituation: Manual entry for new items, scanning only for existing ones. High risk of errors.
Phase1:
- Standardize barcode formats
- Single system (spreadsheet or db) for all entries
- Finance Director approves POs quickly
- Python scripts automate batch uploads
Phase2: - Sync with supplier databases in real time\n- Simple data verification layer flags conflicts
Phase3: - Predictive demand planning for stock entry\n- Automated reorder suggestions (seasonality, promotions, history)

CurrentSituation: Items categorized manually, stored by broad product type, not optimized for quick retrieval.
Phase1: - Assign digital shelf IDs\n- Basic category list for consistent grouping\n- Python helps build simple categorization scripts
Phase2: - AI or rule-based system suggests optimal shelf placement based on demand frequency\n- Barcode scanning tracks item movement
Phase3: - Robotics or AI picking/packing\n- Continuous shelf optimization (learning from picking patterns)

CurrentSituation: Manually tracked allocation to selling floor. Discrepancies between recorded vs. actual stock.
Phase1: - Digital movement log/app to track each product leaving the stockroom\n- Daily/weekly reconciliation
Phase2: - Real-time tracking sensors (RFID) for automatic updates\n- Dashboards highlight allocation discrepancies
Phase3: - AI predicts replenishment needs per shelf\n- Automated orders to maintain optimal floor stock

CurrentSituation: Items moved manually from stockroom to sales floor, no automated updates.
Phase1: - Scan items to 'moved' or 'available' status\n- Single shared db tracks location\n- Finance Director sees large inbound shipments data
Phase2: - Real-time scanning or RFID to monitor movement\n- Notifications for urgent restock items
Phase3: - Advanced analytics on item-flow patterns\n- Automated dispatch signals for shelves nearing low stock

CurrentSituation: Shelves arranged mostly by category, but related items can be scattered.
Phase1: - Create a simple classification scheme (brand/usage)\n- Basic digital shelf map or planogram\n- Capture sales data for future improvement
Phase2: - AI-based product placement (based on sales)\n- Auto-updating planograms as products change
Phase3: - Real-time planogram optimization\n- Shopper behavior heatmaps for granular product placement

CurrentSituation: Prices and promotions set by clerks' experience, often inconsistent.
Phase1: - Centralize pricing in one system\n- Finance Director training for price approvals\n- Python scripts for bulk pricing updates
Phase2: - Rule-based engine auto-applies discounts under conditions (stock age, inventory levels)\n- Analytics dashboard to measure promo impact
Phase3: - AI-driven dynamic pricing in real time\n- Personalized offers based on purchase history

CurrentSituation: ~50,000 items, arrangement not aligned with demand or turnover efficiency.
Phase1: - Track basic foot traffic or busy aisles\n- Log top sellers by location in a spreadsheet
Phase2: - Implement AI to identify high-traffic areas\n- Digital signage/app notifications for cross-selling
Phase3: - AR navigation or advanced store apps\n- Real-time staff deployment based on foot traffic data

CurrentSituation: Barcodes used, but shared codes cause confusion. Daily reconciliations do not fully fix errors.
Phase1: - Standardize barcode assignment (unique codes)\n- POS software flags duplicate barcodes
Phase2: - Advanced POS with image or weight checks\n- Real-time inventory sync at checkout
Phase3: - Cashierless or AI-based recognition\n- Continuous engine refining mislabeled items

CurrentSituation: Informal feedback, no structured analysis. Hard to gather insights or improve.
Phase1: - Encourage basic digital feedback forms\n- Central place to log suggestions/complaints
Phase2: - Data analytics on collected feedback\n- Trend analysis for service improvement
Phase3: - Predictive modeling for customer preferences\n- Personalized recommendations or loyalty programs

CurrentSituation: Reorders depend on manual checks and periodic system suggestions, not real-time analytics.
Phase1: - Basic scanning for low-stock items\n- Finance Director approvals via a shared system\n- Python scripts to highlight reorder thresholds
Phase2: - Automated reordering suggestions via real-time sales & inventory data\n- Supplier integration for immediate restock
Phase3: - Fully AI-driven reorder triggers (forecast-based)\n- Dynamic quantity adjustments factoring seasonality, promotions

CurrentSituation: Manual refunds require supervisor intervention, paper-based process.
Phase1: - Simple digital form for returns (spreadsheet or basic tool)\n- Basic rules for refund approvals
Phase2: - Automated system with predefined approval rules\n- Real-time updates to inventory upon refund
Phase3: - Advanced data checks for fraudulent returns\n- AI-based anomaly detection in refund patterns

CurrentSituation: POs based on weekly/monthly sales data. Supplier errors due to duplicate/incorrect barcodes.
Phase1: - Short finance director training for automated PO sign-off\n- Basic scanning to match barcodes vs. supplier docs
Phase2: - Dynamic POs from real-time sales & stock analytics\n- Enhanced barcode validation to minimize supplier errors
Phase3: - ML-based supply chain optimization\n- Automatic feedback loops for barcode inaccuracies
